Major global actors are starting to engage. “China will help lead a project to identify unknown viruses from wildlife to better prepare humans for major epidemics—if not global pandemics…The Global Virome Project will start in China and Thailand with field work to collect samples from wild animals and analyze the viruses detected”, said Gao Fu, the head of the Chinese Centre for Disease Control and Prevention.
8 Cost estimates for the Global Virome Project range from an initial $1·2 billion to $3·4 billion over a 10-year period.
9 The projected cost is modest when it is put in perspective, in at least four regards.
